page.title: 10Village hall,High Lorton
page.content: The{village-hall}in High Lorton is called The{Yew Tree Hall}because there is a yew-tree behind it where John Wesley once preached.It is a slate building with a slate roof.It is quite long and quite tall,but inside most of it is taken up by one{large single- {storey room}with a slate floor.At one end there is a tiny kitchen with a small meeting room above it. It was built as a{brewery}early in the 19th century by the Jennings family,but they moved to Cockermouth where they still brew beer today. Nowadays it has many{uses:}the{Youth {Club,Women's Institute,Toddlers' Club, {Parish Council}and{Hall Committee}meet in it;{dances,jumble-sales,parties and{whist-drives}are held in it;{film- {shows}are sometimes given in it and the{Caravan Club}hire it for meetings when they are in the area.
